ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] A dilema
ygData.msgSnippet: You should stick with your lvl 8 Monk, It sounds like you have your heart set on that one because you see a chance to go after dragons. It s nice that you
ygData.messageBody:
You should stick with your lvl 8 Monk, It sounds like
you have your heart set on that one because you see a
chance to go after dragons. It's nice that you thought
about helping newbies with your mage, but they will do
just fine without the extra help. I have a 43rd level
Human Ranger (Grof Silversky) that I built from the
beginning with no t'wicks, I hope someday to get
powerful enough to go after dragons, time will tell.
Good luck on your journey.

Luis


--- PsyKo <sibilant_ghost@...> wrote:
> Ok, I am trying to decide which character to get
> settled into. I have a lvl 8 Monk with 209 NATURAL
> AC
> and a h2h attack of 152. I also have a Mage I am
> working on it is also lvl 8. With the mage, I can
> help people in the future, by supplying newbies with
> phantom plate armor, but with the monk, I have
> carefully raised him with very high skill points,
> and
> am able to take on lvl 10-12 equiv mobs. The
> thought
> of taking on dragons is very appealing.
> Any help in deciding which one to go further with
> would be much appreciated. Catch y'all online,
> Marshun AKA Dragonkahn AKA Ustachlak ect... ect...
> ect..
>
> __________________________________________________
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Faith Hill - Exclusive Performances, Videos & More
